Containers.Name: Starbound-GOG-Server
Containers.Description: Run a GOG Starbound Server [br][br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Configuration[/span][/u][/b][br] [b]/starbound[/b] This is where the Starbound files from GOG need to be placed.[br] Set the mount point to a folder in one of your shares, and put the Starbound files inside the folder[br][br] [span style='color: #E80000;']Important[/span]:[br] You [i]must[/i] do the following steps.[br] 1. Download the linux installer script from GOG onto a linux machine.[br] 2. run [span style='color: #56AD00;font-weight: bold;'][code]unzip gog_starbound_*.sh[/code][/span][br] 3. You'll find it extracted 3 folders: [span style='color: #56AD00;font-weight: bold;'][code]data, meta, and scripts[/code][/span][br] 4. Copy the files from [span style='color: #56AD00;font-weight: bold;'][code]data/noarch/*[/code][/span] to the starbound folder that you're mounting in UnRaid.[br] 5. If you're not using IPv6, edit the [span style='color: #56AD00;font-weight: bold;'][code]game/storage/starbound_server.config[/code][/span] and replace [code]"gameServerBind":"::",[/code] with [code]"gameServerBind" : "*",[/code] [br][br] Installation Video:[br] [url]https://youtu.be/QnDf0vxIvek[/url][br][br] [i]Note:[/i] you can, technically, use the steam files if you didn't purchase from GOG. Steam files have not been tested.[br] The files and folders you're looking for are: [span style='font-weight: bold;'][code]docs/ game/ support/ gameinfo start.sh[/code][/span][br][br] Submit any UnRaid issues here: [url]http://lime-technology.com/forum/index.php?topic=48370.0[/url]
Containers.Overview: Docker container to run a GOG Starbound Server.
